intro: Sphaerostephanos ekutiensis, commonly known as the Nigerian starflower, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests and riverine areas. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
